intro: Iranecio eriospermus, commonly known as the hairy Iranecio, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Iran. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in umbels, a common feature in the Apiaceae family. Iranecio eriospermus typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
